thread.title: Bachelorette Australia 2015: Why Sasha was always going to be Sam Frost's man

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Bachelorette Australia 2015: Why Sasha was always going to be Sam Frost's man
text:

Bachelorette Sam Frost chooses Sasha Sam Frost reveals she has finally found love after picking builder Sasha Mielczarek.
PT0M42S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-4508a 620 349 October 22, 2015 - 9:28PM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings The Bachelorette 2015 live blog Which Bachelorette dude are you? Bachelorette Australia returns in 2016 Sam Frost has found love again with Sasha Mielczarek in a emotional final episode of The Bachelorette .
Many suitors swept Sam off her feet, including suave runner-up Michael Turnbull, but the special connection she shared with Sasha was undeniable.
Sam Frost and Sasha Mielczarek in The Bachelorette Australia 2015 finale. 
From passionate kisses to touching conversations, we recap the top moments where we knew the Sydney construction manager was always going to win.
Advertisement Their first meeting 
Of the 14 men on the first night of The Bachelorette , it was definitely Sasha who made the best impression.
From the moment they locked eyes on each other, Sam was rendered tongue-tied around the dreamy tradie, becoming nervous and flustered whenever in his presence.
Later over wine in the mansion's manicured gardens, Sam admitted Sasha made her "turn into a little girl".
"When I first met you I was such a nervous wreck, I don't know what came over me. I just started fumbling over my words, but when it comes to first impressions it was you," Sam said, giving him the first rose the competition.
All of the other guys should have just gone home then.
That steamy first kiss 
Not only did Sasha score the first rose of the competition, but he also snagged the first kiss.
On their first solo date, Sam was flustered once again as she and the brawny Sydneysider did the tango and got a chance to put their hands all over each other.
It wasn't until the cocktail party that Sasha took the plunge and planted Sam with a steamy and lingering pash.
"It was exactly how it was supposed to feel," Sam said, while Sasha admitted to being "lost for words".
Simmering chemistry? Check.
Family ties and painting for charity 
Family is the most important thing in Sam's life and she frequently spoke of her love for her late stepfather who died several years ago from a stroke.
Sasha and Sam immediately bonded over both being children of divorce and being raised by their influential stepfathers.
It was while painting a mural for the Stroke Foundation that Sasha mentioned his grandfather had also been killed by a stroke.
The love between Sasha and Sam was clear as he held her while she cried as she recalled staying by her stepfather's in hospital.
Later on that date, the pair revealed they were falling for each other.
"I love being around you," Sam said. "I think your personality is infectious and I just want more every time I'm around you."
Rescuing Sam after fainting 
Sasha went into ultimate boyfriend mode when Sam became dizzy and faint after their skydiving date on Thursday's semi-final.
As a doctor checked the stunning brunette's vital signs, a concerned-looking Sasha held Sam, giving her water and comforting her, and later admitted he had been "freaking out".
Sam, who was already clearly head over heels for the 30-year-old, said the experience brought them closer together.
"Seeing that side of Sash made me realise that he is the type of guy that would absolutely support you through thick and thin."
Game over.
When Sasha dropped the L bomb 
When Michael mustered up the courage to tell Sam he loved her she gave him a polite thanks. 
When Sasha dropped the L bomb? You could almost feel the earth move.
Sitting on New Zealand hillside, Sasha finally let his guard down and said it would be "devastating" if he were left without her.
"I do love you. I've known for quite a while."
Sam lost it and almost cried her mascara off, later saying she felt 'happy all the way to her soul'. 
"I'm sitting here with an incredible man who could be the one," she said.
And he was.
